definitions.definition: ( countable and uncountable ) An ache or bodily suffering , or an instance of this; an unpleasant sensation, resulting from a derangement of functions, disease , or injury by violence ; hurt .
examples: The greatest difficulty lies in treating patients with chronic pain .
I had to stop running when I started getting pains in my feet.

subdefinitions.definition: ( now usually in the plural ) The pangs or sufferings of childbirth , caused by contractions of the uterus .

definitions.definition: ( uncountable ) The condition or fact of suffering or anguish especially mental , as opposed to pleasure ; torment ; distress
examples: In the final analysis, pain is a fact of life.
The pain of departure was difficult to bear.

definitions.definition: ( countable , from pain in the neck ) An annoying person or thing.
examples: Your mother is a right pain .

definitions.definition: ( uncountable , dated ) Suffering inflicted as punishment or penalty .
examples: You may not leave this room on pain of death.

definitions.definition: ( chiefly in the plural ) Labour ; effort ; great care or trouble taken in doing something.

main_definition: ( countable and uncountable ) An ache or bodily suffering , or an instance of this; an unpleasant sensation, resulting from a derangement of functions, disease , or injury by violence ; hurt .
secondary_definitions: ( uncountable ) The condition or fact of suffering or anguish especially mental , as opposed to pleasure ; torment ; distress
( countable , from pain in the neck ) An annoying person or thing.
( uncountable , dated ) Suffering inflicted as punishment or penalty .
( chiefly in the plural ) Labour ; effort ; great care or trouble taken in doing something.

definitions.definition: Any of various breads stuffed with a filling .

main_definition: ( obsolete , cooking ) Any of various breads stuffed with a filling .
